java.lang.Cloneable
public class MoleculeDNA
extends Molecule
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Either DNA- or RNA-molecule. Use getType() to assess which one it is

kingcarlxx

getStickyEnds

public int[] getStickyEnds()
Returns array indicating the number of missing nucleotides; first cell: 5'-end, last cell: 3'-end. Positive number: Upper strand, negative number: lower strand

Returns:
int[]

setStickyEnds

public void setStickyEnds(int[] stickyEnds)
Sets sticky ends; first cell: 5'-end, last cell: 3'-end. Positive number: Upper strand, negative number: lower strand

Parameters:
stickyEnds - int-Array

setStickyEnds

public void setStickyEnds(int prime5,
                          int prime3)
Sets sticky ends

Parameters:
prime5 - 5'-end: positive number: upper strand, negative number: lower strand
prime3 - 3'-end: positive number: upper strand, negative number: lower strand

isPosOverhang

public int isPosOverhang(int pos)
Checks if nucleotide at position pos is part of an overhang (sticky end)

Parameters:
pos -
Returns:
0 if not part of overhang; negative number if part of upper strand overhang (lower part missing); positive number if vice versa

getType

public java.lang.String getType()
Specified by:
getType in class Molecule
